item.title: Docker Container
item.description:
Managing Docker Containers Like a Pro

‚öôÔ∏è 1. What is a Docker Container?

A container is a running instance of a Docker image ‚Äî a lightweight, isolated environment that can hold your software, tools, and files.

  • Image = the blueprint (a frozen snapshot, like an OS or preconfigured setup)
  • Container = the living instance of that image

When you stop or delete a container, your data and changes can vanish ‚Äî unless you know how to make them persistent.

item.title: Docker Network
item.description:
How to Create and Manage Docker Networks

üîπ What Is a Docker Network?

A Docker network is a virtual layer that connects containers. By default, Docker provides some basic network types:

Network Type Description
bridge Default network for standalone containers. Containers can talk to each other by name on the same bridge.
host Shares the host machine‚Äôs network directly (no isolation).
none Disables networking for the container.
overlay Enables communication between containers across multiple Docker hosts (used in Swarm mode).
macvlan Assigns a MAC address to containers, making them appear as physical devices on your LAN.
